For 30 years, she has worked in crop farming and animal husbandry, a business she started with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work, today Aichurok's farm has two calving dairy cows and five heads of sheep and goats, and her animal husbandry brings in profits of about 3,000 som (KGS) a month. Aichurok also works 1.8 hectacres of land, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial herbs and grasses. Income from this part of the business is seasonal.

Looking towards the long-term development of her business, Aichurok applied for a 55,000 som (KGS) loan at Bai Tushum & Partners. The loan is for the purchase of dairy cows with the goal of increasing milk production. With the income created by the loan, Aichurok plans to invest in the further development of her business by expanding her land cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Sotheary's Group

texts.en:
Sotheary, 30 years old, has three dependent children: one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still in school. Her family lives in the rural village of Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. The main sources of the family’s income arefrom farming rice and planting beans. They supplement their income by raising cows and chickens, which she and her husband have been doing for several years. Drought that destroyed the crop yield is still the main challenge for her business. 

Sotheary’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. This is their first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, Sotheary and her group member are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and KHR 800,000, respectively. As the group leader, Sotheary is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income to improve her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Shakirah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bread, soap and other household staples. 

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, cooking oil, jelly, and rice, and will help Shakirah to generate greater profits and allow her to develop her family more. Shakirah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger retail shop. 

Shakirah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shakirah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, cooking oil, jelly and rice

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 32 year-old business lady and a single mother of two children. She has been running a green grocer business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES.15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mercy will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Osman Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Waterloo, located about 22 mile from Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. This group of teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to solicit a loan of 13,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Osman is the leader of this group of teachers. The 37 year-old is a native of Freetown. He is married to a trader and has 2 school-aged children. Osman has been a teacher for many years now. In addition to his teaching profession, Osman is also a businessman. He has been doing business for 5 years now. As teachers' salaries are normally small, his business helps him earn extra money to complement his monthly salary. Osman has requested for this loan in order to expand his business by buying local produce like rice, palm-oil, etc., in bulk to add to his current stock. He can also use part of the loan to take care of his home.

loans.use: to buy local produce like rice, palm-oil, etc., in bulk to add to his current stock. He can also use part of the loan to take care of his home.

loans.name: José Jaime

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas, lo aprendió con unos amigos, pues su papá no se dedicaba a eso. Cuando se caso, vio la necesidad de trabajar para mantener su hogar, por esa razón desempaño la agricultura. Además, de esa actividad, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la albañilería, trabajo que aprendió con unos amigos. Debido a la necesidad don José manifiesta que ha tenido que aprender muchas cosas.  Entre ellas también esta el trabajar con bueyes arando las tierras para realizar los cultivos, él se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para dar de comer a su bueyes y tomarse una taza de café, luego sale a  su trabajo que esta a media hora de su casa, llega a las 12: 00 p.m. a dar de comer a los bueyes.

Los productos que necesita los compra en la ciudad, para llegar a ese lugar camina a pie unos quince minutos, luego aborda un autobús que recorre durante cuarenta y cinco minutos para llegar a la ciudad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un saco de maicillo, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y  pago de mano de obra.  Con la inversión, él dispondrá de los insumos necesarios para realizar sus cultivos y obtener una buena cosecha que le permita ganar dinero. Entre sus planes están: el ahorrar de los ingresos obtenidos; para construir una casa de ladrillo, pues actualmente vive en una casa de bahareque y el que sus hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera universitaria. Pues a él no se le presento esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
José, 38, lives with his life companion and their two children.  He’s been working in agriculture for the last 20 years; he learned from some friends because his father was not in that occupation.  When he got married he saw that he needed to work to support his home which is why he went into agriculture.  

In addition to this activity, he’s also worked in construction for the last 10 years, work he also learned with friends.  José states that need has led him to learn many things.  Among them is also tilling the land using oxen.  He rises at 4am to feed his oxen and drink a cup of coffee and then heads out to work which is half an hour away from home.  He returns at noon to feed the oxen.  He buys the products he needs in the city and to get there he walks for fifteen minutes to catch a bus that then takes 45 minutes to reach the city.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a sack of sorghum, fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide and to pay labor costs.  With this investment he will have the necessary supplies on hand to plant and to obtain a good harvest that will allow him to earn money.  

Among his plans are: to save some of the income earned to build a brick house because he currently lives in a wattle and daub dwelling and that his children complete university careers because he never had the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar invirtiendo en el trabajo agrícola,en esta ocasión utilizará seis sacos de abono, también herbicidas y pesticidas, él ha tenido un accidente realizando un juego de fútbol, se encontraba divirtiéndose con sus vecinos y amigos cuando se fracturó su mano, la siembra que está realizando en realidad quienes la trabajarán serán sus hermanos y hermanas, pues es una tarea fuerte que actualmente no puede revisar, el préstamo también le dará una parte para poder cubrir algunos cuidados con su mano.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, expandiendo la capacidad de la siembra, logrando sacar una mejor producción, su aspiración es salir de esta situación que actualmente atraviesa y continuar trabajando con los préstamos de kiva.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to continue investing in agricultural work.  On this occasion he will use six sacks of manure and also herbicides and pesticides.  

He’s had an accident playing soccer.  He was enjoying himself with his friends and neighbors when he fractured his hand.  The new planting he’ll undertake will actually be done by his brothers and sisters because it’s hard work he’s unable to do at present.  Part of the loan will also be used to cover some of the cost of his hand’s treatment.

He got positive results from his previous loan; he expanded crop capacity thus obtaining larger yields.  His hope is to overcome the situation he’s going through at present and to continue working with Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Лариса разведена, у нее один взрослый ребенок. Лариса тогует хозяйственными товарами и фейерверками на небольшом рынке в г. Запорожье, Украина. Торговлей она занимается давно. Бизнес - единственный источник ее дохода. Помимо рынка, Лариса выезжает с товаром в ближайшие села, чтобы люди могли купить ее товар на месте. Выездная торговля хотя и не легкое дело (приходиться возить товар с собой и носить сумки с товаром в руках), но приносит дополнительный доход. Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. Бизнес цель Ларисы - получение прибыли и содержание семьи.
texts.en: Larisa is divorced with one grown child. She sells household goods and fireworks at a small market in the city of Zaporozhye, Ukraine. She has worked in commerce for a long time. Her business is her only source of income. In addition to the market, Larisa takes her wares to nearby villages so that people can buy her goods on-site there. Travelling sales is not easy work--she has to carry the goods with her in bags in her arms--but it brings in extra income. Larisa is asking to be granted a loan to expand her range of goods. Larisa's business goal is to make profit and support her family.

loans.use: expand her range of goods.

loans.name: Cristina Marilyn

texts.es:
Cristina Marilyn tiene 30 años de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo de dos años, vive con el compañero y el hijo en Ventans provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely grande, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Cristina Marilyn se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

 Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, líquido para plagas, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas el cogollero, ratón en los cultivos.

 El sueño es tener pollos para criarlos y poder verderlos aún buen precio.
texts.en:
Cristina Marilyn, 30, is in a civil union and has a two-year-old son; she lives with her spouse and son in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) communal bank located in Recinto Cachely Grande that’s part of Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved with short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Cristina Marilyn grows corn and also raises chickens.  Her purchases and her sales of agricultural products take place in Ventanas.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, weed killers and supplies.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops.  She faces challenges like various kinds of plant infestations.  Her dream is to have chicks to raise and sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Edneyda Virginia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chocolates,tortas y pasteles,ella trabaja para contratos de matrimonios,cumpleaños y bautizos,la socia ya tiene 3 años en este negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los chocolates,tortas y pasteles.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como harina,chocolates,mantequilla y azucar.

La socia se siente feliz por el credito y se compromete a pagar en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower still has her business selling chocolates, cakes and pastries. She does contract work for weddings, birthdays and baptisms. She already has three years in this business, and works from 8:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. 

By means of this business, the borrower wants to move forward in life. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell chocolates, cakes, and pastries. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, chocolate, butter and sugar. 

She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, chocolate, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Wilbert Isaias

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo de movilidad escolar,el tiene una combi donde hace servicio de mobilidad,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y la socia ya tiene 6 años en este trabajo,por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito apara comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
This member is still working in school transportation. He has a van he uses for transportation. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.and has been doing this job for 6 years. With this job, he wants to get his children ahead. His dream is to buy a new car. He has asked for the loan to buy tires for his car.

He is happy with the loan he has been given and grateful to the  Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Shomahmad

texts.ru:
Шомахмад проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Шомахмад живет с родителями. Его отец находится на заработках за рубежом. 
Шомахмад имеет среднее образование. Он на протяжении трех лет занимается животноводством. Шомахмад в основном занимается купле – продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он просит кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Shomahmad lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents.  His father is working abroad.  Shomahmad has a secondary education.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  Shomahmad primarily buys and sells cattle.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Deyra María

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio de occidente rodeado de montañas florecidas por la temporada de invierno donde abunda la leche y cuajada que producen sus habitantes.

En él hay muchas personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras y luchadoras como es el caso de Deyra María, de 25 años, casada, madre de una niña, la cual se dedica a laborar como profesora de primaria desde hace cinco años.
Eligió esta profesión porque además de tenerle amor a los niños les gusta enseñarle a leer y escribir los que son el futuro de nuestro país.

Gracias a su profesión y los ingresos de su esposo hoy tienen su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco con la ayuda de créditos y la que quiere ir ampliando para dejarle un buen patrimonio a su hija.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicina, pago de consultas y realización de exámenes médicos con el objetivo de mejorar la salud de su niña y que tenga una infancia alegre.

Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y espera que en futuro le sigan ayudando.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful town in the west surrounded by flower covered mountains in the winter; there is much milk and curd there that’s produced by its residents.  There are many people there who are very hard working and tenacious like Deyra María, 25.  She’s married and is the mother of a little girl.  

She’s been employed as an elementary school teacher for five years.  She chose this profession because besides from loving children she likes teaching those who will be the future of the country how to read and write.

Thanks to her profession and her husband’s income they now have their own house that she’s gradually been improving with help from the loans; she wants to enlarge it to form a good estate to leave for her daughter.  She’s requesting a loan to buy medicine, to pay for doctors’ visits and to carry out some medical exam to improve her daughter’s health so that she can have a happy infancy.

She thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for the support provided via these loans that have helped her to improve her family’s living conditions.  She hopes to continue being helped in the future.

loans.use: to pay for medicine, doctors' appointments and medical exams.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: El Sr. Segundo tiene 46 años de edad,  está casado, tiene dos hijos, y vive en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Don segundo tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de muebles de madera como ser: puertas, marcos para puertas, ventanas, closet, muebles de comedor y otros. Utiliza madera no tradicional y de color para elaborar muebles finos. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero con ODEF y es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar un lote de madera para terminar unos trabajos pendientes que tiene y mantener siempre madera disponible en su taller. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio y obtener ingresos para su bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Segundo, 46, is married and has two children.  He lives in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.  Segundo has been manufacturing wood furniture like doors, door frames, windows, closets, dining room furniture and others for four years.  He uses traditional and colored woods to manufacture fine furniture.  

The loan he’s requesting from ODEF is his third one and it’s for 15,000 lempiras that he will use to buy a load of lumber to finish some pending jobs he has and to have lumber on hand always in his workshop.  His goal is to grow more in business and to earn income for his personal wellbeing as well as for his family’s.

loans.use: to buy lumber to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio esta conformado por 16 mujeres que se dedican a distintas actividades de acuerdo a las posibilidades de casa una, esmerándose dentro de sus aptitudes para sacar adelantes a sus respectivas familias.
La señora Laura tiene 2 hijos y montó su propia despensa pequeña donde ofrece productos de la canasta familiar y también lo necesario para la limpieza e higiene personal. La señora Laura cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para el emprendimiento por ello espera que el negocio crezca y se vuelva cada vez mas competitivo en los precios y en la calidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como lácteos, panificados, bebidas, frutas, hortalizas, etc.
texts.en:
The San Antonio communal bank is made up of 16 women, who do various kinds of work according to the means of each. With the skills they have, they are doing their best to raise their respective families. 

Laura has two children and has set up her own small grocery store, where she sells basic household products and also necessary items for cleaning and personal hygiene. 

For this undertaking, Laura has the help of her two children, so she hopes the business grows and becomes increasingly competitive in terms of price and quality. 

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as dairy products, baked goods, drinks, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, baked goods, meats and soft drinks.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra Norma es madre soltera tiene 1 hija  que aun están en la escuela primaria, ella trabaja diariamente para poder cumplir el rol de padre y madre para su hija.
Ella montó una despensa en su casa que esta ubicada en un barrio muy poblado de la zona. La señora es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe dudas que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Con el crédito desea comprar mas mercaderías como lácteos, carnes, gaseosas, entre otras para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is a single mother of one daughter who is still in primary school. She works every day to be bale to fill the role of father and mother for her daugter.

She opened a store in her house, which is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. She is a very responsible person who wants to get ahead. She has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and there is no doubt that she will meet all of the goals she has set for herself.

With the loan, she wants to buy more merchandise such as dairy products, meat, soft drinks and more to offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as dairy products, soft drinks and meat.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras Kuña Katupyry tiene un total de 14 miembros, se encuentra en su 6° ciclo; las miembros se benefician del crédito con el fin de invertir en sus respectivas actividades, y continuar con sus labores en post de un futuro mejor.
La señora Lucila es macatera  por lo tanto tiene un trabajo diario que lo realiza de forma ambulante acompañada de sus hijas. 
El crédito lo utilizará para poder salir adelante ella y sus hijas, también invertiría en la compra de sábanas, carteras, escobas, ollas, etc.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras Kuña Katupyry” committee has 14 members.  It’s in its 6th cycle.  The members will use the loan to invest in their various activities and continue working in search of a better future.

Lucila is a street merchant; she has daily work she does from place to place in the company of her daughters.  She will use the loan in order to her and her daughters to get ahead.  She will also buy sheets, purses, brooms, pots, etc.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, brooms, pots, etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael tiene 43 años es casado tiene 2 hijos y viven en es casa propia.
El señor es macatero hace mas de 10 años, con la ayuda de su esposa sale todos los días a vender su producto para poder mantener a su familia. Su trabajo es muy cansador ya que tiene que recorrer casa por casa para realizar las ventas. Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela fija que conoce de la calidad y buen precio del señor, igualmente el nos cuenta que con entusiasmo y optimismo en una venta mayor diaria el no pierde la esperanza y sale a vender pensando en un futuro mejor.
El crédito serviría para comprar mercaderías como sábanas,cubre camas, zapatos, entre otros.
texts.en: Ismael, 43, is married and has two children; they live in his own house.  He has been a street merchant for more than ten years.  With his wife’s help he heads out every day to sell his products in order to support his family.  His work is very demanding because he has to go house to house to make sales.  He currently has a regular clientele that knows the quality and good prices he has.  He also comments that he goes out every day with enthusiasm and optimism that he’ll make big sales; he doesn’t lose hope and goes out to sell thinking of a better future.  The loan will be used to buy merchandise like sheets, bedspreads and shoes, among others.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe, Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past ten years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells mattresses. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mattresses and blankets, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and help her live a better life. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to start a wholesale mattress shop. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses and blankets.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is a 43-year-old businessman. He is married to Peninah who is a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been selling cereals for the past fifteen years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Celeste will use the loan to buy more stock of cereals for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open another cereals shop and improve the family standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: La joven Maria Estela de 29 años de edad, casada, se dedica a comercializar nacatamales, hielo y refrescos  desde hace 4 años, es originaria de la capital Managua, a sus 25 años inicio con una venta de chicha una bebida típica del país hecha a base de maíz dulce. Luego  vendió comida después empezó con los nacatamales otros refrescos y hielo que actualmente  este es su negocio, los sábados y domingos vende hot-Dog y sándwich. Para la elaboración de los nacatamales le ayudan las mujeres de su familia. Vende su producto en su casa de habitación y en un colegio donde le vende comida a los profesores, su esposo le ayuda económicamente ya que el trabaja vendiendo ropa. A Maria Estela le gustaría ubicar su producto en otro local a parte del de su domicilio ya que  las expectativas que tiene es expandir su negocio, reproducir las ventas y acondicionar el local en el que ella vende su producto. Por este motivo ella solicita un préstamo kiva para poder comprar una mantenedora con el objetivo de vender mas productos refrigerados y asi ofrecer diversidad  de productos a sus clientes. Maria opina que la oportunidad que le ofrece este crédito  será de éxito para ella ya que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas a través de más productos y económicamente mejorara su nivel de vida. Una de sus metas próximas es seguir incrementando sus clientes e invertir en un nuevo negocio como es vender ropa y tratar de esforzarse más y poner su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
María Estela, 29, is a young married woman.  She’s been selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales], ice and soft-drinks for the last four years.  She’s from the capital, Managua.  At the age of 25 she started selling chicha, a traditional beverage made from sweet corn.  Then she started selling food and after that nacatamales, soft-drinks and ice which is her current business.  On Saturdays and Sundays she sells hot-dogs and sandwiches.  The women in her family help her make the nacatamales.  She sells them at home and at a school where she sells food to the teachers.  Her husband helps her economically since he works selling clothes.

María Estela would like to set up business somewhere other than in part of her home because she wants to expand the business, multiply sales and equip the space where she sells her product.  Because of this she’s requested a Kiva loan to be able to buy a freezer so that she can sell more refrigerated goods thus offering wider variety to her customers.  María is of the opinion that the opportunity this loan offers is success for her because it will allow her to increase sales through more products and her standard of living will improve economically.  One of her future goals is to continue increasing her customer base and to invest in a new business like clothing sales; she will strive harder to try to open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,estofado de carne,sopas entre otros comidas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollo,verduras y carnes.

La socia esta feliz con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en: She continues in the restaurant business.  She prepares various dishes like roasted chicken, meat stew, and soups, among others.  She works from 8am until 6pm and has six years’ experience.  Her dream is to expand the restaurant.  She’s requesting the loan to buy chicken, meats and vegetables.  She’s happy with the granted loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and single. She sells shoes to earn a living.  She has employed one person in her business.  She improved her business with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to grow her business in the future and employ more people.

Grace has requested 20,000 KES to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,la socia vende trigo,cebada y habas,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio de venta de cereales,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales porque ella solo tiene un pequeño puesto.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,trigo y cebada al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the cereals business.  She sells wheat, barley and lima beans.  She works from 7am until 6pm and has four years’ experience in this business selling cereals.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the cereals because she currently only has a small stand.  She requests the loan to buy corn, wheat and barley at wholesale.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and barley at wholesale.

loans.name: Ivon Lobsagna Lee

texts.es: Ivon, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo Santa Bárbara. Hace 6 años que Ivon, estableció su propio negocio, donde brinda servicio de impresión de fotografía, encuadernación, laminado y servicios secretariales. Ha hecho crecer el negocio mediante préstamos que le ha otorgado ODEF, con el que solicita actualmente son tres préstamos. Con el cual va comprar materiales como papel de impresora y tintas, para fotografía, papel para laminar, folders, y material de encuadernación. Ella quiere que su negocio le genere más ingresos y aumente la clientela. Su meta es ser una persona exitosa en el negocio y tener siempre su fuente de ingresos para su hija.
texts.en:
Ivon, age 31, is a single mother with a daughter.  She lives in the Macuelizo municipality in the Santa Bárbara department.

Six years ago Ivon established her own business.  She provides services printing photographs, binding, laminating, and secretarial services.  She has made her business grow through the loans given to her from ODEF.

With the loan she is requesting now there are three loans.  She will use the current loan to buy materials like printing paper and ink for photography, paper for laminating, folders, and binding material.  She wants her business to generate more income and to increase her clientele.

Her goal is to be a successful person in the business and to always have a source of income for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy materials like printing paper and ink for photography, paper for laminating, folders, and binding material.

loans.name: Edmundo Americo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vinos,licores y piscos,el distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden estos licores,el socio tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones,blusas,polos y chompas,el socio tambien vende la ropa en forma independiente,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.El socio solicita el credito para comprar vinos,licores y piscos y tambien para comprar chompas,pantalones y blusas.

El socio  está contento con el crédito otorgado y agradece a los inversionistas de kiva.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in his business of selling wines, liquors, and piscos. He distributes to the various stores that sell these liquors. He also has a business selling clothing such as pants, blouses, polo shirts, and sweaters. He also sells clothing independently. His dream is to have a shop where he can sell clothing. He is applying for the loan to buy wines, liquors, and piscos and also to buy sweaters, pants, and blouses to sell.

He is happy with the loan offered to him and is grateful to the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy wines, liquors, and piscos to sell to stores and also to buy sweaters, pants, and blouses to sell

loans.name: Isatu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from an orphanage in Wellinton, Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. 

This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to solicit a loan of 11,00,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Isatu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 44-year-old is a native of Yengema. She is married to a nurse, and the couple has nine children attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. 

Isatu has been a teacher for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for her children.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Jackson has been working hard  managing his farm, where he grows pineapples, coffee, and bananas. 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy seeds to grow pineapple and coffee.  That will help Jackson to generate greater profits and increase his income and ability to grow. 

Jackson hopes that in the future, he will be able to enlarge his farming on a larger scale. 

Jackson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow pineapple and coffee

loans.name: Nafaret

texts.en:
Nafaret is 35 years old and married, with two children, both attending secondary school. 

She didn't have a job at all until two years back when she started her own livestock business. She purchased some milk cows and started selling milk to dairy farms. Later on she sold baby calves as well. “I am not investing time and efforts at this business because I’m forced to do it to generate an income," she said. "I enjoy my involvement on it, because it gives me the opportunity to nurture the animals at the same time that I am generating profit.” 

At the moment, Nafaret is applying for a Kiva loan through VisionFund Albania to purchase one more milk cow in order to expand her existing herd. She has borrowed previously from the VFA institution and has repaid the loans on time. 

With the extra profit she plans on generating, she will be investing in planting fodder for animals, instead of buying it. This way, she will be able to put money aside for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy another milk cow for her herd.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony continues working hard in his tailoring business to continue providing for his family. He began his business because he wanted to engage himself in an income-generating activity after he dropped out of school, and this is his only source of survival. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) every month from this business. 

He would like another loan in the amount of KES 50,000 to meet the growing demand for clothes. Antony has already received and successfully repaid a loan. With this loan, he will be able to purchase more materials to make more clothes for sale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi lives in Kapan town with her husband and two sons: 2-year-old Vigen and 6-year-old Alex. Varduhi's husband serves at the local military unit. He also helps Varduhi to run the farm, where they breed cows and hens. 

Currently the cows number only two, and Varduhi wants to purchase more cattle to receive more milk.  With the help of this loan, Varduhi plans to purchase two calves and two cows. 

Varduhi hopes she will earn more income, which will allow her to improve conditions in her household and ensure a more prosperous life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and two cows

loans.name: Fausto Xavier

texts.es:
Fausto Xavier tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo de dos meses de edad, vive con los padres en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Fausto Xavier se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas de los productos lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, ranger. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá realizar la siembra y obtener mejores utilidades, Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas de cogollero. 

El sueño es tener una mejor calidad de vida .En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Fausto Xavier, 22, is single, has a two-month-old son, and lives with his parents in Ventanas in Los Ríos province. He is a member of the communal bank "el DIVINO NIÑO"  [Divine Child], which is located in Estero Lindo in Ventanas canton. The group performs seasonal farmwork, planting corn and rice.

Fausto Xavier grows corn and also raises livestock. He buys and sells in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, supplies, and weed killer so that he can plant and earn more profit. He faces challenges such as bollworm infestation. He dreams of having a better life and likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, supplies, and weed killer.

loans.name: Zegjine

texts.en:
Zegjine is in her late fifties and lives in the central part of Albania with her husband and their seven children.  She is a Romani woman from the Roma ethnic minority community. 

Zegjine has been selling used clothes and shoes for the past 18 years now.  The earnings she has made through this business have been the only source of income for their family, she said. “Without it, I don’t know what I would do, with all the children I had to raise,” Zegjine declared.

This is her first loan.  She wants to buy a greater quantity of used items, this time adding more variety to her current stock.  Zegjine’s promise to lenders is that she will pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of used items, such as clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 54 years old and married, with one child, aged 16. 

To earn a living, Esther runs a grocery.  She has been operating the business for over 10 years.  Even though she runs her business in a competitive environment, she is able to retain most of her customers because of her good reputation.

Esther hopes to own a big business premises in the future.  She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy fruits and expand her business premises.

loans.use: To buy fruits and expand her business premises.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She has two children, with one of them currently in school. 

For the past seven years, Mercy has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells skirts, tops, trousers, and dresses. 

To help expand her business, Mercy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dresses and skirts in specific colors and cuts.  It will help Mercy to generate greater profits and increase the range of her inventory to attract customers. 

Mercy hopes that in the future she will be able to open another boutique. 

Mercy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mercy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more dresses and skirts in specific colors and cuts.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité renacer cuenta con 14 miembros que se dedican a distintas actividades que ya se encuentran en su 10° ciclo; se las ve entusiasmada con lo que hacen, realizadas y esperanzadas en seguir creciendo individual y grupalmente.
Una de las integrantes la señora Alfreda se dedica a la venta de bijouteri de forma ambulante, la señora recorre las casas ofreciendo a sus clientes diseños modernos coloridos y juveniles, esta actividad la realiza con esmero y en pro de un futuro mejor para ella y su familia.
La señora necesita del crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como hilos, canutillos, tijeras, hilo de pescar, etc. Gracias a eso ella aporta a su casa un ingreso neto que proviene de su propio esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The Renacer communal bank has 14 members who work at different business activities.  They are in their tenth cycle, and they are enthusiastic about what they do, fulfilled, and hopeful about continuing to grow individually and as a group.

Alfreda is one of the members.  She sells costume jewelry in an itinerant manner.  She goes to the houses offering her customers modern designs that are colorful and youthful.  She does this business activity with dedication in order to make a better future for her and her family.

She needs the loan to buy greater quantities of raw materials like string, beads, scissors, and fishing line, etc.  Thanks to this she contributes to her house a net income that comes from her own effort.

loans.use: to buy string, beads, and scissors, etc.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 30 years old and married, with three children. 

She operates a beauty salon to earn a living. In the same premises, she also offers printing and photocopy services for a fee. She has been in this business for three years and has employed one person.

She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to grow her business. She has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy braids, hair chemicals, and hair oil.

She dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future.

loans.use: To buy braids, hair chemicals, and hair oil.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 28 years old and the single mother of one child, who is in school. 

She operates a retail shop to earn a living.  She also operates a mobile money transfer (m-pesa) shop in the same premises. She has been in this business for eight years. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy soft drinks and sugar and add to her m-pesa float.

Alice dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and sugar and to add m-pesa float

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: El señor Juanito tiene 35 años de edad conviviente con la Sra. Aida se dedican a la agricultura que es la fuente de sus ingresos económicos producen papa, haba, oca, papaliza con practica de rotación de cultivos en terreno de 1,5 Has que es herencia de su padres, en la actividad tiene bastante experiencia en cuanto manejo de los cultivos, tratamientos fitosanitarios, cosecha y mercadeo, ellos viven en la comunidad de Rosario a 52 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba Juanito necesita dinero de urgencia que le faltó un monto para reintegrar de la casa que está comprando, porque actualmente ellos viven en la casa de sus padres, el sueño de Juanito es tener una casa propia para vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Juanito, 35, lives with his domestic partner Aida and is a farmer. He earns his living growing potatoes, beans, and oca on a rotating basis on the 1.5 hectares of land he inherited from his parents. He has a lot of experience in crop management, phytosanitary treatments, harvesting, and marketing. They live in Rosario, which is 52 km from the city of Cochabamba. 

Juanito needs the loan urgently because he lacks the money to pay for the house he is buying. He now lives with his parents. Juanito dreams of having his own home so that he can live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy a house.

loans.name: Tite

texts.en:
Tite is 38 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife, three children (5, 7 and 8 years old), and parents. His children go to the local school. Tite’s mother is a pensioner. 

Tite runs an animal husbandry business. He owns five milk cows, five calves, and two pigs. He produces dairy products and sells cheese, pork, and beef locally. In addition, Tite has agricultural land where maize and haricot are grown. He sells these agricultural productions at the local market as well.

Tite is very hard-working man, with a rich experience in his work.

Tite requested a loan to purchase two oxen. After the oxen are purchased, he will be able to bring his harvest and hay for cattle at home easily. He will take wood from the forest for winter season as well. 

Tite plans to expand his animal husbandry and agricultural business. As a result of this Kiva loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable him to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Tite hopes for your help and kindness

loans.use: to purchase two oxen

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en:
Jamali is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Jamali has been working hard to manage his small business, where he sells drinks and food in a hotel (a small restaurant). 

To help expand his business, Jamali has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more food to his restaurant, and will help Jamali to generate greater profits and increase his daily income. Jamali hopes that, in the future, he will be able to grow his business and also open up another restaurant in town. 

Jamali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jamali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more food to his restaurant.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 30 years old, and his partner is Mary. They have no children yet.

He is a very hardworking man, and he has been farming since he was young.  Recently, he started a tire repairing business in cases of punctures.  Amos is working hard to make sure that he fulfills his family's needs.

Amos will use this money to purchase a compressor to enhance efficiency in his business.  This is his first loan with Yehu, so he is committed to paying it on time. 

He is excited because he is sure he will achieve his goals using this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Felix Ruperto

texts.es:
Felix tiene 36 años de estado civil Soltero vive solo no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Felix Ruperto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Guaranda y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los Cantones de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es seguir aumentando la cantidad de producción del maíz sobre todo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta jugrar futbool con los amigos
texts.en:
Felix, 36, is single and has no children. He lives in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. His communal bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES is located in Los Ángeles in Ventanas canton. The group does seasonal farmwork, planting corn and rice. Felix Ruperto plants corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Guaranda and sells them in the market there and at fairs in neighboring cantons.

He requested this loan to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer to plant corn and rice. The loan will help him increase his income to feed his family and to invest. More than anything, he dreams of increasing his corn harvest. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 41 years old and married, with five children, all in school. 

John practices farming for a living. He mainly grows maize in his farm.  He has engaged in this business for five years, and he has employed two people. He also has another job. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save and boost his business because he has been trained in business management. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer.

He dreams of owning a large piece of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Nol

texts.en:
Nol is now 53 years old, and he is married to Leah. They are blessed with three children. 

He will use the loan to buy more farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizers, and spray, so as to improve his output.  He has been in this business for eight years now.  It earns him an income of 13,700 KES. 

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD.  He  will use the anticipated profit from his business to buy more acres of land for farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings, and sprays

loans.name: Xayal

texts.en:
Xayal is 29 years old and single; he lives with his parents. 

Xayal is a hardworking man who loves his work.  He is a merchant.  For the past four years, Xayal has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. Xayal needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy goods to expand his stock. 

In this way he will attract more customers, and from his profit, he will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy goods to expand his stock.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Halima. She is married and has five children. 

In 2011, she established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in providing for the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about KES 10,000 as profit every month from this business. 

Halima now requires a loan in order to buy a large stock of charcoal and increase her profit. She would like a loan in the amount of KES 40,000.

In the future, she plans to own a charcoal depot. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a large stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 57 years old and married, with six children. 

Jean Damascene sells various goods, such as rice, sugar, and tomatoes.  He has eight years of experience in this work, and he currently employs one person to help him.  He works from 8 a.m until 6 p.m every day. 

Jean Damascene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods, such as sugar, lotions, cooking oil, beans, and maize, for resale. 

With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es: Oscar de Jesús  de  53 años de edad del municipio el realejo un pequeño pueblo bastante pobre donde la mayor actividad económica es la ganadería. Oscar está casado con dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad. Se desempeña como obrero. Oscar está solicitando el prestamos para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación las cuales consisten en repello y finos de paredes internas de la casa, mejoras que no las había podido realizar por  falta de capital, ya que su salario no le permite invertir en dicho mejorar, y su única manera es de optar por el crédito. En la foto Oscar esta señalando las mejoras que quiere realizar.
texts.en:
53-year-old Oscar de Jesús is from the municipality of El Realejo--a very poor village where the main economic activity is [centered] on livestock.  Oscar is married with two children, aged 20 and 16. He works as a laborer. 

Oscar is requesting the loan to make improvements to his home, which include plastering and finishing the interior walls of the house.  [These are] improvements that he has not been able to carry out due to a lack of capital.  Since his salary does not allow him to invest in the previously mentioned improvements, his only way [to accomplish them] is to [request] a loan. 

In the photo, Oscar is pointing out the improvements that he would like to make.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home, which include plastering and finishing the interior walls of the house.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik lives in Mrgavan village, in the Ararat region, with her mother and 2 sons. Satenik and her sons run a farm, where they keep hens, cultivate corn and grow fruit trees. Satenik would like to renovate the greenhouse and purchase a polyethylene cover for it. In addition, she plans to purchase fertilizer to help with the cultivation. Satenik also needs some funds to pay for watering the land and orchard and for fees for the land. This loan will help Satenik to cover all these costs and to keep gathering a stable income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, a polyethylene cover, greenhouse renovations, watering costs and fees for the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate and paint the restaurant

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en: Phillis, 43 years old, is married to Martin and they are blessed with three children. Phillis has been farming for the last six years, earning a monthly income of 19,500 KES. This is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock such as fertilizers, seedlings and tomatoes. Phillis will use the anticipated profit to buy a plot of land and to construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana Isabel tiene 49 años, Es soltera vive con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Juana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es aumentar la produccion y tener su propio terreno.

Le gusta reunirse con la familia
texts.en:
Juana Isabel, 49, is single and lives with her children in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, which is involved in growing corn and rice, is located in the Los Ángeles community which belongs to Ventanas Canton. 

Juana grows corn and rice, buying her supplies in Comercial Procan and selling her produce in the wholesale market in Ventanas. 

She is requesting a loan to plant corn and rice, and to buy supplies and fertilizer. With the help of the loan she will be able to meet her needs. Her dream is to increase production and buy her own land.

She enjoys meeting up with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 40 years old, is married and has three children who are in school. For the past 11 years, she has operated a retail shop in a busy environment with reliable customers. Through Faulu Kenya, Nancy has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. Nancy's dream is to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to  buy vegetables, onions and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Gorica

texts.en:
Gorica lives in a Serbian community in Kosovo. She is married and has two adult children. Gorica and her husband have operated a food shop business for more than 20 years in their community. They started with a small food shop and they have now managed to expand it. In addition to the Serbian community, Gorica and her husband serve Albanians and other communities living in Kosovo.

Gorica is requesting this loan in order to buy foodstuffs for her market in order to better meet the needs of her customers from all communities in her village. She hopes that the loan will assist her in increasing the size of her shop and improving her living conditions. Gorica's goal is to expand her business and to involve her children. She is very happy for the financial support that KIVA lenders give her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her market

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella es natural de la ciudad de Abancay pero vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco. Ella es ama de casa y se dedica con mucho esmero a tender a sus hijos y a su esposo. Su esposo es un hombre responsable y trabajador que se dedica a brindar servicio de transportes. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento del carro o sea va comprar llantas y lubricantes. 

Isabel está recibiendo el préstamo como un miembro del banco comunal "Manos Juntas", que se reúne mensualmente en el Cusco. La ciudad de Cusco se encuentra a 3.400 metros sobre el nivel del mar en la cordillera de los Andes.
texts.en:
Isabel is 38 years old. She is married, and from this beautiful relation she has three children. She is a native of the city of Abancay but she lives in the enchanting city of Cusco. She is a homemaker and works with great conscientiousness to care for her children and her husband. Her husband is a responsible and hard-working man who offers transportation services. At this time she needs the loan to maintain the car, that is, to buy tires and lubricants.

Isabel is receiving the loan as a member of the communal bank "Manos Juntas" (Hands Together), which meets monthly in Cusco. The city of Cusco is located 3400 meters above sea level in the Andes mountain range.

loans.use: to maintain the car by buying tires and lubricants

loans.name: Al  Ouma  Sicap Mbao Groupe 2

texts.fr: C'est  un groupement  mixte de 10 personnes qui adhèrent dans la meme association et exercent des activités génératrices de revenus séparées. Ils sont représentés par madame Aminata (personne qui a levé sa main sur la photo)c’est une femme mariée très active  qui évolue depuis plus de 30 ans dans le domaine du mareyage et du commerce de poissons. Son activité consiste à fréquenter plusieurs plages du territoire sénégalais, a  pré financer des pêcheurs  qui lui procurent les poissons  qu’ils ramènent de mer  pour lesquels elle aura l’exclusivité de l’achat. C’est une femme soutien de famille qui supporte les charges de dépense quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de sa famille. Elle s’adonne à son activité journalière ment a partir de 7 heures jusqu'à 22 heures le soir. Elle sollicite un crédit  prévu pour le renforcement de son fond de roulement. Ce financement lui permettra de s’approvisionner d’avantage en poissons et de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce. Son objectif est élargir le nombre de ses employés a 6 personnes, d’accroitre ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, épargner de l’argent afin de pouvoir acquérir dans le futur une maison qui lui sera personnelle.
texts.en:
This is a coed group of 10 people who belong to the same association and who work at individual revenue-generating businesses. They are represented by Aminata (raising her hand in the photo), who is a very active married woman. She has been developing her fish and seafood wholesale business for over 30 years. Aminata's business consists of visiting various beaches in Senegal and financing fishermen who then give Aminata the exclusive right to purchase the fish they bring back from the sea.

Aminata is the wage earner for her family who is responsible for all the daily expenses and schooling costs. She devotes herself to her daily business, leaving at 7 o'clock in the morning and working until 10 o'clock in the evening. She is requesting a loan to increase the investment ability with her business. The loan will allow her to stock up on more fish and to make her business more profitable.

Aminata's goal is to increase the number of her employees to 6 people, increase her profit and improve her family's living conditions, and to save money with the goal of being able to one day purchase a home for herself.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Riziki Mupya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankafu, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Riziki Mupya », est entrepreneur, âgée d’environs  48 ans, mariée, mère de 13 enfants, tous étudient, parmi lequel, il y a des juristes avocats et des universitaires. Elle est vendeuse de friperie et distributeur agrégée des cartes des unités de téléphone cellulaire. Son mari est un haut fonctionnaire de la Régie de voies ariennes (RVA). Elle a commencé son business avec son fonds propre. Elle étale ses marchandise au long de la route, à l’entrée de la douane RD Congo-Rwanda. Il y a 16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 17 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 ballons de friperie. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Nankafu, the representative of the business group Riziki Mupya, is an entrepreneur, married woman about 48 years old, the mother of 13 children. All of Nankafu's children attend school, and them are solicitors, lawyers, and university students. Nankafu is a seller of used clothing and an authorized distributor of mobile phone cards. Her husband is a high-ranking government official with the State Airways Agency (RVA). 

Nankafu began her business with her own funds. She sets her merchandise out by the side of the road, at the customs entrance of RD Congo-Rwanda. She has been doing this for 16 years. During this time, Nankafu has completed 17 loans with Hekima's microcredit program. This new loan will allow her to stock up with one bundle of second-hand clothing. Additionally, she hopes to send her children to school. Nankafu thanks Hekima for its activities helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banking institutions.

loans.use: to purchase one bundle of second-hand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Justino Ignacio

texts.es:
Justino Ignacio tiene 44 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con un hijo de 7 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Justino  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar un carro y aumentar la produccion.

En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbool con los vecinos
texts.en:
Justino Ignacio is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 7 year old son in the Cantón Ventanas Province of Ríos.

The members of the V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES group are located in the Ángeles district which belongs to the Cantón Ventanas Province. The members of this communal bank work in agricultural jobs such as growing corn and rice crops.

Justino grows corn and rice crops for a living. He buys his materials at Comercial Procan and sells them at Ventana's wholesale market.

He is requesting the loan to plant more corn and rice, buy materials and fertilizer to maintain the crops. The loan will support him financially by helping him supply his farm. His dream is to buy a car and increase the yield of his crops.

During his free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, 27, lives in the town of Kaloleni with her common-law husband and their three children. She has been engaged in commercial activity since 2010, when she began her business with the goal of helping pay for household expenses to achieve greater family wellbeing.

In her business, she sells water to people in her neighbourhood who have become her main customers. She sells on credit, adjusted to her customer’s abilities, and she still receives good profits out of it.

Bahati works from Monday to Sunday and spends 12 hours daily at her business, with the goal of generating more and more income, however, she needs to expand her inventory and her working capital is insufficient to do so. She is requesting a loan to purchase water pipes to replace some leaking ones. This problem has been disturbing her for a long time and she hopes to get relief once she receives the loan.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes to replace leaking ones

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 51 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 5 and 20 years. His business is well-organized; he employs one person to help him and works from 6am until 6pm every day. He has one year of experience.

Fidele has requested a loan from Kiva lenders Vision Finance Company in order to buy more quantities of potatoes. With the profits from this loan, Fidele will pay for his children's school fees and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes for selling

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 32-year-old farmer. She is married to Antony, who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been rearing poultry for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Nancy will use the loan to buy poultry feed and chicks. 

With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the poultry business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and chicks

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is now twenty three years old and she is married to Joseph. They are blessed with one child. Her husband is a farmer and supports her with additional income. She will use the loan to buy more stock items for her general shop like rice, wheat flour, and soaps for sale.

She has been in this business for a period of three years earning her a monthly income of KES. 13,000. This will be her second loan KADET LTD. She will use the anticipated profit to buy a piece of land for horticulture farming.

loans.use: To buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and soap

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 40 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con tres hijos de 13, 10 y 9 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luis Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra y vende los productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas, urea, insecticidas y abonos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y mejorar los ingresos de la familia. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la lancha que cae a los cultivos. El sueño es prosperar economicamente y comprar una casa grande para la familia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y labores de la casa.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 40 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and three children, ages 13, 10, and 9, in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.

He is a member of the communal bank El Divino Niño (The Divine Child), which is located in the Estero Lindo district, part of the Ventanas canton. This communal bank works with short cycle farming activities such as planting corn and rice.

Luis Alfredo works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sells his products in Ventanas.

He is applying for the loan to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides, and compost so that he can plant corn and rice. The loan will help him economically to supply his needs and improve the income of his family. He faces challenges such as pests in his fields and the frosts that fall on his fields. His dream is to prosper economically and buy a big house for his family.

In his free time he likes to play sports and do household tasks.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, and compost in order to plant corn and rice

loans.name: Salem Group

texts.en:
Salem group is made up of 3 women who are from Teshie. This group was formed in 2011 and are still together. They sell drinks, cloth, and sandals. They meet every Wednesday to discuss business and payment of loans. They have been with ID-Ghana since 2010.

Matilda is a 43-year-old drinks seller, married to a 45-year-old businessman. They have 2 children who are in schooling. This is her second loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Her childrens' ages are 13 years and 20 years.

Matilda has been doing this job for 5 years, which shows a lot of experience. She needs this loan to buy more Coca-Cola, Fanta, Malta Guiness, and Alvaro to sell to customers. She was given 350 Ghana Cedis in the first loan cycle and now needs 700 Ghana Cedis to expand the business. Her monthly profit is 90 Ghana Cedis, which she uses partly to help her husband with family expenses and partly on reinvestment.

They need a total amount of 2,600 Ghana Cedis to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell to customers

loans.name: Swairu

texts.en:
Swairu is 52 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. He has one child. For the past six years, Swairu has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells candies, Pampers, bread, and other household goods. 

To help expand his business, Swairu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods like jelly, biscuits, and soap, and will help Swairu to generate greater profits and increase his daily income. Swairu hopes that in the future he will be able to grow his business and also set up a wholesale shop. 

Swairu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Swairu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods like jelly, biscuits, and soap to sell in his retail shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is now thirty four years old and married to Kiarie. They are blessed with one child. She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more stock of cloth material for making dresses for her customers.

She has been in the dressmaking business for the last four years earning a monthly income of eleven thousand.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the anticipated income to open another tailoring business. She hopes to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: buying more stock of cloth material for making dresses for her customers.

loans.name: Ndaane Doole Gawane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Ndaane doole gawane" est un cadre de solidarité qui compte cinq femmes toutes mariées.Elles s'appuient mutuellement dans leur activité de vente de fruits et légumes.Elles se cotisent chaque semaine pour épargner à l'UIMCEC afin d'obtenir des prets.Ce commerce leur rapporte des revenus non négligeables qui leur assurent une prise en charge correcte des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles en général et de satisfaction des besoins de leurs enfants en particulier.Le chef du groupe( main levée, au milieu du groupe), est mère de trois enfants.Elle parvient à subvenir à ses propres besoins et à s'occuper de la santé et de l'habillement de ses enfants.
Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des fruits et des légumes.Leur ambition est d'évoluer vers le commerce en gros.
texts.en:
The Ndaane Doole Gawane Group is made up of five married women. The women each pursue their own business of selling fruits and vegetables. They contribute savings each week to UIMCEC in order to qualify for loans. This business earns them substantial income which enables them to stay on top of expenses for their families in general, and specifically to meet the needs of their children.

The leader of the group (hand raised, in the middle of the group) is the mother of three children. She succeeds in meeting her own needs and taking care of the health and welfare of her children. In order to increase their business funds, the group is requesting a loan of 500000 francs CFA to purchase fruits and vegetables. Their goal is to turn the business into wholesale trade.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marjel

texts.en:
Marjel is a twenty-six-years-old talented and hard-worker Egyptian man from one of the most vulnerable ethnic communities of the south eastern part of Albania. 
Marjel is a dressmaker and has been doing piece work for various dressmaking manufacturers for a long time now and also working for himself this past year. He has been able to build an excellent clientele through his hard work and personable nature. In addition, he is a basketball referee with a small team in his city. Almost everyone in the city where he resides and deals with him speaks very highly of him.
Marjel is requesting a loan to buy textile raw fabric material at this time. In the past, he had requested other loans that helped him purchase a sewing machine all of which he has repaid successfully. Marjel wants to thank both organizations for trying to help him out and especially the loan officers of VisionFund Albania and Kiva lenders for their understanding.

loans.use: To purchse textile raw fabric

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en: Nzingo, 55, is widowed and has two children, one of whom attends school. Her economic activity (source of income) is selling firewood from her home. She has had the business for one year.  The goal of the loan is to invest in her business. With the loan, she will be able to purchase additional stock of firewood to take advantage of some upcoming events which she has already received orders for. Nzingo is determined to continue educating her son.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of firewood

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Maria Leonor de 54 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos, ella se dedica a vender  productos medicinales hecho a base de plantas. Tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Este tipo de negocios le ha permitido obtener ingresos por su propia cuenta, lo vende de manera ambulante. María ha solicitado un crédito kiva para invertir en compra de  productos tales como  batidos  controladores de peso, reducción de azúcar, medicamentos para la presión arterial  elaborados a base de plantas.
Ella estima que   los productos que compre aumentara sus ventas generando mayores  ganancias  poder expandirse hacia otros departamentos. Sus planes futuros son abrir una cadena de club alimenticio en Managua donde puedan dar a conocer sus productos, mejorar su nivel de vida tanto el de ella como el  de sus clientes ofreciéndoles opciones de calidad para mejorar su nivel alimenticio promoviendo el consumo sano de alimentos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Leonor is 54 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She sells plant-based medicinal products. She has worked in this business for 2 years. This type of business has allowed her to obtain her own income. She sells her products as a walking vendor. Maria has applied for a Kiva loan to invest in the purchase of products such as weight-control shakes, sugar reducers, and medication made from plants to control blood pressure.

She estimates that the products that she buys will increase her sales, generating more earnings to expand into other areas. Her future plans are to open a chain of dietary clubs in Managua where her products can be made known, and to improve her standard of living as well as that of her customers, by offering them quality options for improving their nutritional level, promoting the healthy consumption of food.

loans.use: to buy plant-based products such as weight-control shakes, sugar reducers, and medications for blood pressure.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married and has seven children and all of them live in northern Albania. Until two years ago, she was a stay-at-home mom. Liza said that life for them was very difficult because her husband was the only financial provider for the family of nine. Yet, her priority until two years ago, when she started the business, was to raise the children.
